[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Doughnut Ordering System (DOS) defines requirements for order placement, scheduling, transactions, and processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DOS ensures order management, inventory tracking, scheduling, and payments.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DOS integrates with order processing, scheduling, inventory management, and payment services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DOS provides a responsive web and mobile UI for customers to schedule deliveries and track orders.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DOS runs on cloud infrastructure, supporting all devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DOS utilizes React.js frontend, Node.js backend, and PostgreSQL for secure data management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: DOS ensures encrypted data transmission via TLS 1.3.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DOS optimizes performance with caching and efficient data indexing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: DOS supports real-time updates and multi-device compatibility.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DOS connects to authentication, payment, and delivery tracking APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 MISSING-TAG2: DOS manages authentication, payments, inventory updates, and customer notifications.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DOS enables seamless order placement, delivery scheduling, inventory tracking, and secure payments.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DOS serves customers placing orders and administrators managing fulfillment processes.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DOS relies on API security, cloud hosting, and encrypted payment processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Order Tracking: Tracks real-time order status.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 MISSING-TAG1: DOS requires stable internet connectivity for transactions and order tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with order, payment, and tracking APIs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall synchronize real-time order updates with external services.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall require customers to specify a delivery time before completing an order (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow customers to modify delivery time preferences before order confirmation (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall provide real-time order tracking and customer notifications (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for delivery selection and order tracking (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall confirm orders and delivery schedules within 3 seconds (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain 99.5% uptime with continuous monitoring (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall restrict delivery time modifications after order confirmation.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with secure payment processing and data protection policies (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure high availability, security, and real-time fraud monitoring (REQ-COMP-001, REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store orders, payments, and delivery preferences (REQ-INTF-002).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Order placement, delivery scheduling, and payment security validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and system security guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: E-commerce standards, secure payment best practices, and UI/UX design guidelines.
